text: There was a very angry lion, roaring and screaming for no reason. And a deer saw him from afar, and cried, Woe unto us, the other beasts of the forest! If the lion was still, we were so unbearable, what shall he not be able to do now? Don't give power to the angry ones, because if they hurt us for no reason, they'll do more when they're not content.
title: El león y el ciervo
author: nan Esopo
